thread.title: CommBank customers unable to access money as tech outages hit
thread.title_full: CommBank customers unable to access money as tech outages hit | afr.com

author: Liam Mannix
title: CommBank customers unable to access money as tech outages hit
text:
Declined: Technical problems have hit Commonwealth Bank customers. Bradley Kanaris Share on twitter Share on Google Plus by Liam Mannix Commonwealth Bank customers have been hit by a widespread technology outage affecting their credit cards , net banking, mobile banking, phone banking ATM, Bpay and eftpos services.
"The cause is under urgent investigation & we're working to fix this as top priority," CBA replied to one frustrated customer on its Twitter feed.
There are reports that money paid for bills is not going through, and several customers report being stranded at supermarkets and service stations, unable to pay for fuel or groceries.
Customers are reporting error messages on their Commonwealth Bank smartphone app, and problems accessing their credit cards or home loan accounts.
Furious users are taking to social media to vent. It was only a few months ago that the bank suffered a huge, similar outage on a Friday, although that one only lasted a few hours. This outage appears to have already gone on for much longer.
There are also complaints from customers of being unable to use their credit and debit cards in stores. Phone banking is also hit, as are travel money cards.
Widespread outages are affecting Commbank customers. Do you see this message in your app? pic.twitter.com/SMxlg4vXe3
— Liam Mannix (@liammannix) September 10, 2015 Unreal. Netbank in a very bad way pic.twitter.com/anNmEtLYDd
— Liam Mannix (@liammannix) September 10, 2015 This person is overseas and can't get money from travel card, ATM, BPAY, EFTPOS, Netbank. #commbank pic.twitter.com/1Q6d3ZEDxt
— Liam Mannix (@liammannix) September 10, 2015 The bank's social media account has been fielding queries from stranded customers since Thursday night.
On Twitter, the Commonwealth Bank account has been blaming the problem on "planned updates" taking "a little longer than we hoped".
A Commonwealth Bank spokeswoman said the bank was working on a fix to "intermittent issues".
"We are aware some customers are experiencing intermittent issues accessing some of our systems," she said.
"The cause of the problem is under urgent investigation and we are working to have full services restored as a matter of priority. We apologise for the inconvenience to customers and thank them for their patience."
More to come.
